synopsis: In episode #6 of Pineapple Blood Rotation, hosts Devam and Ahir dive deep into the themes of self-worth and neuroticism, sharing personal experiences and insights about emotional growth and the importance of understanding oneself. Their candid conversation explores how past traumas shape our present and the necessity of compassion for both ourselves and others on the journey of self-discovery.
quotes: Understanding my self-worth has been the most liberating journey I've ever embarked on.
You can't truly be altruistic unless you're egoistic to a certain extent.
It's hard to recognize the unique experiences we all share when we're lost in our own heads.
I realized that the emptiness I felt was where my self-worth should have been.
Every time I tried to inject something new into my life, it overwhelmed me.
You are free as a human being to modify your framework at your own will.
Sometimes the problems we can't acknowledge scare us more than the ones we can.
Not being able to see the world outside of your own thoughts can feel like a prison.
I finally feel more in control of my life than I ever have before.
It's okay to forget; it means you're no longer holding on tightly to every thought.
